security: Disclosing operational details about the MRR roll up, safe house locations, and identities of individuals working against the CASTRO regime could jeopardize ongoing operations and endanger those involved. Specifically, revealing Subject's friends employed in power plants in Cuba and their potential roles could lead to their persecution. Quoting the document: 'Attachment "A" contains a list of subject's friends that are currently employed in power plants in Cuba' and 'Attachment "B" is a debriefing report on Angel BENCOMO who Sanchez believes was responsible for the MRR roll up.'
summary: A CIA dispatch forwarding a debriefing report on Santiago SANCHEZ de la Torre, who provided information on the MRR roll-up in Cuba and identified individuals working in power plants and a person believed to be responsible for the MRR roll up.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret dispatch from the Chief of Station, JMWAVE, dated September 3, 1963, transmits a debriefing report on Santiago SANCHEZ de la Torre, who arrived in the U.S. via Mexico. SANCHEZ provided insights into the Movimiento Revolucionario del Recuperaci√≥n (MRR) roll-up in Cuba. The dispatch includes a list of SANCHEZ's friends working in Cuban power plants and a debriefing report concerning Angel BENCOMO, whom SANCHEZ suspects of being responsible for the MRR's downfall. Clarence E. SMERYAGE was the case officer for the debriefing, which took place at Safehouse #182 on August 29-30, 1963.
title: TIPIC/Operational Debriefing Report - Santiago SANCHEZ de la Torre
